     205             : 
     206             :   OwningEffectSet mEffects;
     207             : 
     208             :   // These style rules contain the style data for currently animating
     209             :   // values.  They only match when styling with animation.  When we
     210             :   // style without animation, we need to not use them so that we can
     211             :   // detect any new changes; if necessary we restyle immediately
     212             :   // afterwards with animation.
     213             :   EnumeratedArray<EffectCompositor::CascadeLevel,
     214             :                   EffectCompositor::CascadeLevel(
     215             :                     EffectCompositor::kCascadeLevelCount),
     216             :                   RefPtr<AnimValuesStyleRule>> mAnimationRule;
     217             : 
     218             :   // Refresh driver timestamp from the moment when transform animations in this
     219             :   // effect set were last updated and sent to the compositor. This is used for
     220             :   // transform animations that run on the compositor but need to be updated on
     221             :   // the main thread periodically (e.g. so scrollbars can be updated).
     222             :   TimeStamp mLastTransformSyncTime;
     223             : 
     224             :   // Dirty flag to represent when the mPropertiesWithImportantRules and
     225             :   // mPropertiesForAnimationsLevel on effects in this set might need to be
     226             :   // updated.
     227             :   //
     228             :   // Set to true any time the set of effects is changed or when
     229             :   // one the effects goes in or out of the "in effect" state.
     230             :   bool mCascadeNeedsUpdate;
     231             : 
     232             :   // RestyleManager keeps track of the number of animation restyles.
     233             :   // 'mini-flushes' (see nsTransitionManager::UpdateAllThrottledStyles()).
     234             :   // mAnimationGeneration is the sequence number of the last flush where a
     235             :   // transition/animation changed.  We keep a similar count on the
     236             :   // corresponding layer so we can check that the layer is up to date with
     237             :   // the animation manager.
     238             :   uint64_t mAnimationGeneration;
     239             : 
     240             :   // Specifies the compositor-animatable properties that are overridden by
     241             :   // !important rules.
     242             :   nsCSSPropertyIDSet mPropertiesWithImportantRules;
     243             :   // Specifies the properties for which the result will be added to the
     244             :   // animations level of the cascade and hence should be skipped when we are
     245             :   // composing the animation style for the transitions level of the cascede.
     246             :   nsCSSPropertyIDSet mPropertiesForAnimationsLevel;
     247             : 
     248             : #ifdef DEBUG
     249             :   // Track how many iterators are referencing this effect set when we are
     250             :   // destroyed, we can assert that nothing is still pointing to us.
     251             :   uint64_t mActiveIterators;
     252             :
